howler 0.1.0
  • Reference

Howler.js Player

Source: R/player.R
howlerPlayer.Rd

howlerPlayer is used to initialise the 'howler.js' framework by adding all of the specified tracks to the player, and can be run by either including UI buttons or server-side actions.

In order for howlerPlayer to work, useHowlerJS must be included in the application UI.

howlerPlayer(
  id,
  files,
  volume = 0.7,
  autoplay_next = TRUE,
  autoplay_loop = FALSE,
  seek_ping_rate = 1000
)

Arguments

id

HTML id tag to be given to the howler player element

files

Files that will be used in the player. This can either be a single vector, or a list where different formats of the same file are kept in each element of the list

volume

How loud the player should start off at. Defaults to 0.7 (70%). If howlerVolumeSlider is included, then this will be overridden by the value used there.

autoplay_next

If there are multiple files, would you like to auto play the next file after the current one has finished? Defaults to TRUE

autoplay_loop

Once all files have been played, would you like to restart playing the playlist? Defaults to FALSE

seek_ping_rate

Number of milliseconds between each update of `input${id}_seek` while playing. Default is set to 1000. If set to 0, then `input${id}_seek` will not exist.

Value

A shiny.tag containing all of the required options for a Howl JS object to be initialised in a shiny application. On the server side there will be up to four additional objects available as inputs:

{id}_playing

A logical value as to whether or not the howlerPlayer is playing audio

{id}_track

Basename of the file currently loaded

{id}_seek

(If seek_ping_rate > 0) the current time of the track loaded

{id}_duration

The duration of the track loaded

Details

All buttons associated with the howlerPlayer should be given the same id argument. This is to ensure that the buttons are linked to the player.

i.e. If howlerPlayer(id = "howler"), then howlerPlayButton(id = "howler")

See also

howlerButton, howlerServer

Examples

if (interactive()) {
  library(shiny)

  ui <- fluidPage(
    title = "howler.js Player",
    useHowlerJS(),
    howlerPlayer("howler", "audio/sound.mp3"),
    howlerPlayPauseButton("howler")
  )

  server <- function(input, output) {
  }

  runShiny(ui, server)
}

if (FALSE) {
# Multiple file formats
howlerPlayer(
  "howler",
  list(
    c("audio/sound.webm", "audio/sound.mp3"),
    c("audio/sound2.webm", "audio/sound2.mp3"),
  )
)
}
